name: clawed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A clawed creature has claws (= the sharp curved nails at the end of some animals' toes, or the pointed parts at the end of some insects' legs): She drew a small clawed creature. The bear raised a clawed paw ready to strike.
More examplesFewer examplesThe monster clapped a clawed hand on his shoulder.The engraving seems to show some sort of clawed animal."I'll get you!" shrieked the witch, pointing a clawed finger at him.The cat prodded its half-dead prey with a clawed paw.
